alert.note: Alert for Whitman (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 5:25AM PST until March 03 at 11:32AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Palouse River near Potlatch affecting Latah and Whitman Counties. .Rain this morning and this afternoon is expected to push the Palouse River above flood stage this afternoon and evening. For the Palouse River...including Pullman, Potlatch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Palouse River near Potlatch. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Extensive flooding of the low lying areas between Potlatch, ID and Palouse, WA will occur. Flooding will occur at the Lions Club Community Park and Hayton Greene Park in Palouse. South River Road will likely be flooded where it crosses the Palouse River at Wellesley Rd. The Potlatch softball and baseball fields will start to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:46 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Rain this morning and this afternoon is expected to push the Palouse River above flood stage this afternoon and evening. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 15.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.1 feet on 02/02/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM PST.
